verses.t: LordIn the {H3068} put I my trust{H2620}: how say{H559} ye to my soul{H5315}, Flee{H5110} as a bird{H6833} to your mountain{H2022}?

For, lo, the wicked{H7563} bend{H1869} their bow{H7198}, they make ready{H3559} their arrow{H2671} upon the string{H3499}, that they may privily{H1119} shoot{H3384} at the upright{H3477} in heart{H3820}.privily: Heb. in darkness
If the foundations{H8356} be destroyed{H2040}, what can the righteous{H6662} do{H6466}?

LordThe {H3068} is in his holy{H6944} temple{H1964}, Lord'sthe {H3068} throne{H3678} is in heaven{H8064}: his eyes{H5869} behold{H2372}, his eyelids{H6079} try{H974}, the children{H1121} of men{H120}.
LordThe {H3068} trieth{H974} the righteous{H6662}: but the wicked{H7563} and him that loveth{H157} violence{H2555} his soul{H5315} hateth{H8130}.

Upon the wicked{H7563} he shall rain{H4305} snares{H6341}, fire{H784} and brimstone{H1614}, and an horrible{H2152} tempest{H7307}: this shall be the portion{H4521} of their cup{H3563}.an horribleâ€¦: or, a burning tempest
For the righteous{H6662} Lord loveth{H157} righteousness{H6666}; his countenance{H6440} doth behold{H2372} the upright{H3477}.
